bibl.title: Letter from Peter W. Suarez to Philip Showalter Hench, July 30, 1942

div1.p: Suarez thanks Hench for the return of the Dominguez manuscript on Finlay, and for the reprint of Hench's yellow fever article. He has sent Hench's article to Dominguez' widow.

div1.head: Letter from Peter W. Suarez to Philip Showalter Hench, July 30, 1942
div1.opener:
AMERICAN CAR AND FOUNDRY EXPORT COMPANY
30 CHURCH STREET
NEW YORK
July 30, 1942.
CABLE ADDRESS
CARMAKER, NEW YORK
Personal.
Dr. P. S. Hench,
Mayo Clinic,
Rochester,
Minnesota.
My dear Dr. Hench:
div1.p:
I wish to thank you very much for your kind letter
of July 15th, and I take pleasure in advising that I have
already in my possession the manuscript of the Biography of
Dr. Carlos J. Finlay, by the late Dr. Francisco Dominguez,
of Havana, Cuba.

I also wish to thank you for your courtesy in
sending me a reprint of the address you gave at Cleveland,
Ohio, at the unveiling of Dean Cornwell's painting
“Conquerors of Yellow Fever”. I have found it most
interesting, and have taken the liberty of sending it to
Dr. Dominguez' window, at Havana. She will be glad to
note that due credit is given in this country to the work
of Dr. Finlay.

Thanking you again for your kind cooperation
in this matter, I beg to remain,
div1.closer: Yours sincerely, Peter W. Suarez. a,c,f,
